CatDescriptText: Cutline for image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 13, 1964, pg. 23, reads: "Ready for Action - Members of the Pittsburgh Monarchs baseball team opened play last week in the American Legion Baseball League and were beaten in their opener by Hazelwood, 4-1.  Members of the team are, left to right, front row:  Chester (Pedro) Stanard, Teddy Woodson, Michael Sims, David Jones, Kenny Durett, Ronald Baulding, Theodore Brooks and Jon Wambi Cook.  Back row: Mrs. Alberta Broaden, team organizer; Charles Jenks, Reginald Moore, Alvey DeArmint, Larry Seals, Cleveland Edwards, Calvin Morgan, Joe Looney, Ronald Jackson, Anthony Austin and Robert Broaden, bat boy. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Monarchs American Legion League baseball team, front row from left: Chester (Pedro) Stanard, Teddy Woodson, Michael Sims, David Jones, Kenny Durett, Ronald Baulding, Theodore Brooks, Jon Wambi Cook; back row: team organizer Alberta Broaden, Charles Jenks, Reginald Moore, Alvey DeArmint, Larry Seals, Cleveland Edwards, Calvin Morgan, Joe Looney, Ronald Jackson, Anthony Austin and bat boy Robert Broaden, posed on field
